tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Played in 15 events on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica and recorded three top-10s and eight top 25s to finish 34th on the Order of Merit…His best finish was solo fourth at the All You Need is Ecuador Open in September… His other top-10s were T6 at the Guatemala Stella Artois Open and T10 at the Dominican Republic Open… Missed the cut at the Mexico Championship in his only start of the year on the Web.com Tour…Claimed his second career win on the Mexican Tour at his home course, the Club Campestre Tijuana, in July. Led the 54-hole event from start to finish, posting rounds of 65-69-67 to win by five over Rodolfo Cazaubón. Dedicated his win to his grandmother, Yolanda, who had passed away six weeks earlier… Finished T93 at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December.

2014: Became the first ever left-handed player to win on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica with his victory at the Stella Artois Open at the Fuego Maya GC at La Reunión Golf Resort on March 30. Carded a birdie on the 72nd hole to finish at 14-under 274 and win by one over Argentina's Nelson Ledesma. Was the tournament's outright leader through 36 holes and had a share of the 54-hole lead… Shared runner-up honors at the Hyundai – BBVA 88th Abierto de Chile, where he finished one stroke behind tournament champion Jorge Fernández Valdés… With a victory, three top-10s, six top-25s and 11 cuts made in 16 starts, he went on to finish the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked 7th on the Order of Merit… Made the cut in two of three starts on the Web.com Tour… Finished T109 at Web.com Tour Q-School in December.

2013: In 11 PGA TOUR Latinoamérica starts, made six cuts, with two-top 10s. Finished T2 at the Puerto Rico Classic presented by Merrill Lynch, an event shortened to 54 holes. Held a one-shot lead entering the final round but finished bogey-bogey to lose by one to Ryan Sullivan. His other top-10 was a T6 at the TransAmerican Power Products CRV Open in Guadalajara, Mexico. Finished the season 26th on the Order of Merit...Won his first career tournament as a pro on the Mexican Tour in March, capturing the Club de Golf La Herradura in Monterrey, Mexico. Had five top-five finishes to finish No. 2 on the Mexican Tour's Order of Merit...Missed the cut at the Mexico Championship in his only Web.com Tour start of the season, in May… Finished T88 finish at the Web.com Tour Q-School Final at PGA West in California in December.

2012: Finished the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica ranked No. 10 in the Order of Merit. Had three top-10s, seven top-25s and eight cuts made in 11 starts...A T6 finish at the TransAmerican Power Products Open in Monterrey, Mexico was his best of the season...Also finished T4 at the Roberto De Vicenzo Invitational Copa NEC...Turned in a T10 at the 59th Brazil Open...Earned his PGA TOUR Latinoamérica card as one of five players exempt from the Mexican Tour...Made his first career start on the PGA TOUR, at the Mayakoba Classic in Mexico (missed cut)...Finished T48 at the Web.com Tour's Mexico Open in June. 

2011: Was named Mexican Tour's Rookie of the Year after collecting four top-fives and seven top-10s in 10 starts...Also played events on PGA TOUR Canada.

2010: Turned pro in April...Made his professional and Web.com Tour debut at the Mexico Open, where he missed the cut...Competed on PGA TOUR Canada and the Mexican Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won three college events during his senior year playing for Loyola-Chicago, was a three-time Player of the Year at the school and Loyola-Chiago's Athlete of the Year in 2009… Played on 2005 California high school state championship team for San Diego's St. Augustine High School.
tourBios.personal: Attended St. Augustine High School in San Diego, Calif…If not a professional golfer would be a financial adviser…Favorite course played is Pinehurst No. 2…Would like to play St. Andrews…Favorite teams are the Loyola (Chicago) Ramblers, the San Diego Padres, the San Diego Chargers and the Los Angeles Lakers…Favorite movies are "Wedding Crashers" and "Scent of a Woman."…Favorite entertainers are The Killers, Coldplay and Jay-Z…Favorite athletes are Kobe Bryant and Floyd Mayweather, Jr…Favorite places are Park City, Utah, and Chicago…Would like to trade places for one day with F1 pilot Sebastian Vettel…First-tee introduction song would be "Pursuit of Happiness."… Ben Hogan, Michael Jordan and Víctor Regalado would round out his dreamed foursome… Regalado, the only Mexican player ever to win on the PGA TOUR, used to be his instructor and remains a close friend… Not many people know that he played baseball for 13 years… Favorite quote is: “For what does it profit a man to gain the whole world, and forfeit his soul?”… Twitter name is @FavelaArmando… Instagram name is @armandofavela

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T93 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.intlVics: (2) 2013 Club de Golf La Herradura [Mex], 2015 Club Campestre Tijuana [Mexico]

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri in 2016 is T14th at the Lexus Panama Classic.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T55th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Latinoamérica.
